What is the wisdom behind Rami al-Jamarat (stoning the pillars)?

Rami al-Jamarat teaches unquestioning obedience to Allah's commands. Even when wisdom isn't apparent, Muslims submit completely to divine instructions. This ritual embodies the essence of 'Uboodiyyah (servitude) by prioritizing Allah's decree over personal understanding.

When was Hajj made obligatory in Islam?

Hajj was made obligatory in 9 AH (the year of the Delegations) according to the correct view. This is established by the revelation of Surah Al 'Imran (3:97) where Allah commands: 'And Hajj to the House is a duty mankind owes to Allah for those who can afford it.'

How many times is Hajj obligatory in a Muslim's lifetime?
